qas.question: What type of climate does St. Barts typically have?
How many hectares does the island have in total?
How much average rainfall does St. Barts get per year?
When does summer end in St. Barts?
What is the lowest nighttime temperature recorded at St. Barts?
How much water falls on average on the eastern side per year?
How much rainfall comes down during the dry season on average?
What is the average temperature throughout the dry season?
What is the average temperature throughout the rainy season?
How much rainfall falls each year on average during the rainy season?

context: The island covers an area of 25 square kilometres (<a1_0>2,500<a1_0/> ha). The eastern side is wetter than the western. Although the climate is essentially <a0_0>arid<a0_0/>, the rainfall does average <a2_0><b5_0><b6_0><b9_0>1000 mm<b9_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/> annually<b6_0/>, but with considerable variation over the terrain. Summer is from May to <a3_0>November<a3_0/>, which is also the rainy season. Winter from December to April is the dry season. Sunshine is very prominent for nearly the entire year and even during the rainy season. Humidity, however, is not very high due to the winds. The average temperature is around 25 °C with day temperatures rising to 32 °C. The average high and low temperatures in January are 28 °C and <b7_0>22 °C<b7_0/>, respectively, while in July they are 30 °C and <b8_0>24 °C<b8_0/>. The lowest night temperature recorded is <a4_0>13 °C<a4_0/>. The Caribbean sea waters in the vicinity generally maintain a temperature of about 27 °C.
